hanzi-su-wiki:
宮

Значения

Синтоистский храм; императорский дворец

Мнемоника

Большой дом 宀, где имеются, как минимум, два зала с переходом — внешний и внутренний. Дворец.

Варианты

宫

gōng
palace; temple; castration (as corporal punishment); first note in pentatonic scale
дворец; храм; кастрация (как телесное наказание); первая нота в пентатонике

(Simplified: 宫)
Pictophonetic: 呂 indicates the sound; 宀 (roof) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
宮廷 [ gōng tíng ]: court (of king or emperor)
宮殿 [ gōng diàn ]: palace; Classifiers: 座

heisig_chinese_memo: House with a spine, Shinto shrine. House with a backbone, palace and a throne!
heisig_constituent: shinto shrine, house, spine, mouth, drop, mouth2
heisig_story: Way back in lesson 2 we learned the character for spine. The two other characters in which it is used we can now learn together in this and the following frame. Here a Shinto shrine is composed of house and spine.
koohiiStory1: This Shinto shrine is built with human spines. Have you ever seen the ossuary in Sedlec, near Kutna Hora in Czech Republic ? It is a small church entirely decorated with human bones. Do a web search for "sedlec ossuary", it´s quite a sight.
koohiiStory2: A friend of mine made up a rhyme for this one: "house with a spine, Shinto shrine"!
jp_example_words:
お宮(おみや): Shinto shrine
宮殿(きゅうでん): palace
jp_readingExamples: 宮殿 (きゅうでん), 宮廷 (きゅうてい), 離宮 (りきゅう), 宮 (みや)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: It may just be a roof over a bathtub, but this here is actually a Shinto shrine.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: It is indeed just a roof over a bathtub, but I guess spirits inhabit everything according to Shintoism, so there's no reason this bathtub can't be a Shinto shrine too.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What god does this Shinto shrine hold? You see that "It's a-me-ya! (Mario!)"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: It makes sense, the person who says "It's-a-me! (Mario)" is someone who works on bathtubs (and plumbing).

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the spine (呂) is under the roof (宀) of the palace
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The spine of ancient China was a big house called the palace where all of the important decisions were made.
humanum_full_description_en:
The Jiajin inscription starts from the "宀" from the two squares, and the "宀" is like a house. Li Xiaoding believes that the two squares are two connected houses. The original meaning is a palace.

Oracle bone inscriptions do not follow " Lu " (" Lu " means " Lu ", " Lu " is like two golden cakes, and has nothing to do with the word " Gong " in the elephant palace), but later mixed with " Lu ". Xu Zhongshu believes that the elephant door and the roof ventilation window are in the shape of a Lu, so the name is Gong. The squares sometimes overlap, which Li said is more reasonable. Oracle square or two that " palace at the beginning," the text, or that " Yong " the beginning of the article, see the " Yong ."

The oracle bone inscriptions represent the residence of the king of Shang, and are also used as place names. Bronze or " nine " is the sound symbol, and it can be used in four ways: 1. It means residence and palace, Yin Gui: "Wang Cai (in) Zhou Xingong"; 2. It means ancestral temple, and Fang Yi: "Ming used sacrifices in Beijing "Gong"; three, one of the five tones, Zenghou Yizhong: "The Palace of Gu Xi"; 4. Used as a clan name and personal name, a tripod for the father: "Xin Gongyi (given) to give money to the father and silk."

"Shuowen": "Shi Ye. Congruo, Ming Shengsheng. All palaces belong to the palace." "Er Ya. Shi Gong: "The palace is the room, and the room is the palace."
humanum_short_description_en: " Gong " is originally " Gong ", and the inscriptions from "宀" from "宀" are two squares. Li Xiaoding believes that the two square image rooms are connected, and the original meaning is palace room.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「宀」從兩個方形，「宀」象房屋，李孝定認為兩個方形象兩間相連的房子，本義是宮室。

　　甲骨文不從「吕」（「吕」即「呂」字，「呂」象兩個金餅，與象宮室的「宮」字無關），但後來與「呂」相混。徐中舒認為象門與屋頂通氣窗，呈吕形，故名為宮。按方形有時重疊，李說較合理。甲骨文兩方形或以為「宮」之初文，或以為「雝」之初文，參見「雝」。

　　甲骨文表示商王的居室，又用為地名。金文或加「九」為聲符，用法有四：一，表示居所、宮室，殷簋：「王才(在)周新宮」；二，表示宗廟，夨方彝：「明公用牲于京宮」；三，五音之一，曾侯乙鐘：「姑洗之宮」；四、用作氏名和人名，舍父鼎：「辛宫易(賜)舍父帛金」。

　　《說文》：「室也。从宀，躳省聲。凡宮之屬皆从宮。」《爾雅．釋宮》：「宫謂之室，室謂之宫。」
humanum_short_description: 「宮」本作「宫」，甲金文從「宀」從兩個方形，李孝定認為兩個方形象房室相連，本義是宮室。

  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 宀 [gàimian2] roof; house
    • 呂 [ lǚ ] a musical note; surname
①房屋(封建時代專指帝王的住所)：宮室。宮廷。宮殿。宮觀(guàn)(ａ．供帝王遊樂的離宮；b．道教的廟宇)。宮禁。宮苑。宮刑。
②神話中神仙居住的房屋：天宮。龍宮。蟾宮。
③廟宇的名稱：雍和宮。
④一些文化娛樂場所：少年宮。文化宮。
⑤天文上黃道分爲十二宮，每一宮三十度。
⑥中國古代五音之一，相當於簡譜“1”。
⑦指“子宮”(婦女生殖器官)。
⑧姓氏。

宮殿 [ gōng diàn ]: palace; Classifiers: 座

甲金文從「 宀 」從兩個方形，「 宀 」象房屋，李孝定認為兩個方形象兩間相連的房子，本義是宮室。 甲骨文不從「 吕 」（「 吕 」即「 呂 」字，「 呂 」象兩個金餅，與象宮室的「 宮 」字無關），但後來與「 呂 」相混。徐中舒認為象門與屋頂通氣窗，呈吕形，故名為宮。按方形有時重疊，李說較合理。甲骨文兩方形或以為「 宮 」之初文，或以為「 雝 」之初文，參見「 雝 」。 甲骨文表示商王的居室，又用為地名。金文或加「 九 」為聲符，用法有四：一，表示居所、宮室，殷簋：「王才(在)周新宮」；二，表示宗廟，夨方彝：「明公用牲于京宮」；三，五音之一，曾侯乙鐘：「姑洗之宮」；四、用作氏名和人名，舍父鼎：「辛宫易(賜)舍父帛金」。 《說文》：「室也。从宀，躳省聲。凡宮之屬皆从宮。」《爾雅．釋宮》：「宫謂之室，室謂之宫。」
The Jiajin inscription starts from the " 宀" from the two squares, and the " 宀" is like a house. Li Xiaoding believes that the two squares are two connected houses. The original meaning is a palace. Oracle bone inscriptions do not follow " Lu" (" Lu" means " Lu", " Lu" is like two golden cakes, and has nothing to do with the word " Gong" in the elephant palace), but later mixed with " Lu". Xu Zhongshu believes that the elephant door and the roof ventilation window are in the shape of a Lu, so the name is Gong. The squares sometimes overlap, which Li said is more reasonable. Oracle square or two that " palace at the beginning," the text, or that " Yong" the beginning of the article, see the " Yong." The oracle bone inscriptions represent the residence of the king of Shang, and are also used as place names. Bronze or " nine" is the sound symbol, and it can be used in four ways: 1. It means residence and palace, Yin Gui: "Wang Cai (in) Zhou Xingong"; 2. It means ancestral temple, and Fang Yi: "Ming used sacrifices in Beijing "Gong"; three, one of the five tones, Zenghou Yizhong: "The Palace of Gu Xi"; 4. Used as a clan name and personal name, a tripod for the father: "Xin Gongyi (given) to give money to the father and silk." "Shuowen": "Shi Ye. Congruo, Ming Shengsheng. 宮字的基本解释

宮
gōng
同“宫”。

宮字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gōng］
“宫1”的旧字形。

宮字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【宀字部】　宮； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页285第16
【唐韻】居戎切【集韻】【韻會】居雄切【正韻】居中切，?音弓。【說文】室也。从宀，躳省聲。【白虎通】黃帝作宮室，以避寒暑。宮之言中也。【釋名】宮，穹也。屋見垣上穹隆然也。【詩·大雅】雝雝在宮。【周禮·內宰六宮註】婦人稱寢曰宮。宮者，隱蔽之言，天子謂之六寢。　又【禮·儒行】儒有一畝之宮。【註】宮，牆垣也。【儀禮·士昏禮】母戒女曰：夙夜無違宮事，古者貴賤所居，皆得稱宮，至秦始定爲至尊所居之稱。　又宗廟亦曰宮。【詩·召南】于以用之，公侯之宮。【孔氏曰】可以奉祭祀曰事，祭必於宗廟曰宮，互見其義也。　又學名。【禮·曲禮】諸侯曰頖宮。【註】謂半於天子之宮也。　又官名。【周禮·天官】宮正掌王宮之戒令糾禁。　又五音中聲曰宮。【前漢·律歷志】宮，中也。居中央，暢四方，倡始施生，爲四聲綱。【史記·樂書】宮，土音，聲出於?，合口而通之，其性圓而居中。五聲六律十二管，還相爲宮也。【註】宮爲君主之義，當其爲宮，五聲皆備。　又腐?曰宮。【書·呂?宮辟註】宮，淫?，次死之?也。

вм. 宫
Radicals: 宀, 呂  (roof, bathtub)
Meaning Mnemonic
It may just be a roof over a bathtub, but this here is actually a Shinto shrine.
It is indeed just a roof over a bathtub, but I guess spirits inhabit everything according to Shintoism, so there's no reason this bathtub can't be a Shinto shrine too.
Reading Mnemonic
What god does this Shinto shrine hold? You see that "It's a-me-ya! (Mario!)"
It makes sense, the person who says "It's-a-me! (Mario)" is someone who works on bathtubs (and plumbing).
